intro: Phyllorkis polyrrhiza, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its woody stems and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
